isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - DISASSEMBLE - CLUTCH PACK (HEAVY-DUTY)

step1.para: Place differential and gear support case (clutch pack up) on workbench.

warning.para: Exercise care during disassembly procedure (Step 2 below). The gear support case cover is under spring pressure and the ring gear may fall off the support case after the last locknut is removed. Take precautionary measures to prevent personal injury or parts damage during procedure in Step 2, below.

step1.para: Remove self-locking nuts and bolts, then lift off gear support case cover and compression springs ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Lift Off Gear Support Case Cover and Compression Springs

step1.para: Lift up and remove clutch pack assembly from the differential and gear support case ( Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Remove Clutch Pack Assembly From Differential and Gear Support Case

step1.para: If ring gear had an interference fit and did not fall off as previously mentioned in the warning note for Step 2, tap ring gear alternately on opposite sides with soft-nosed hammer until ring gear is free of gear support case flange.
Disassemble Clutch Pack. To disassemble clutch pack, use a press and suitable adapters.

note.para: This procedure can be accomplished with clutch pack removed from or installed in support case ( Figure 18).

step1.para: Compress clutch pack, then remove "round" snap ring ( Figure 18). Remove pressure plate, then alternately remove tanged and splined friction plates from friction plate driver ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Remove Tanged and Splined Friction Plates From Friction Plate Driver

step1.para: If necessary, remove "rectangular" snap ring from friction plate driver.
If necessary to remove bearing cone from differential case cover, place pilot punch in holes provided and tap on bearing cone inner race alternately through each hole until cone is removed.

Inspect Friction Plates. With plates removed, inspect surfaces for deeply scored or burned condition. If a faulty condition is found or if torque check indicates a worn condition (refer to CTD EFFECTIVENESS CHECK
), replace the clutch pack.
